com.twilio4j.twism

Interface SmsParameters


  • public interface SmsParameters
    Twilio will pass the following parameters in addition to the standard TwiML Voice request parameters with its request to the 'statusCallback' URL of Sms.
    Author:
    broc.seib@gentomi.com

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getBody() 
      java.lang.String getMediaContentType(int n)
      The ContentTypes for the Media stored at MediaUrl{N}.
      java.lang.String getMediaUrl(int n)
      A URL referencing the content of the media received in the Message.

    • Method Detail

      • getMessageSid

        java.lang.String getMessageSid()
        Returns:
        The Sid for the Sms message

      • getSmsSid

        @Deprecated
java.lang.String getSmsSid()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns:
        The Sid for the Sms message

      • getMessagingServiceSid

        java.lang.String getMessagingServiceSid()
        Returns:
        The 34 character id of the Messaging Service associated to the message.

      • getBody

        java.lang.String getBody()
        Returns:
        The text body of the message. Up to 1600 characters long. (That's up to 10 concatenated messages of length 160.)

      • getNumMedia

        int getNumMedia()
        Returns:
        The number of media items associated with your message

      • getMediaContentType

        java.lang.String getMediaContentType(int n)
        The ContentTypes for the Media stored at MediaUrl{N}. The order of MediaContentType{N} matches the order of MediaUrl{N}. If more than one media element is indicated by NumMedia than MediaContentType{N} will be used, where N is the count of the Media
        Parameters:
        n - which media element.
        Returns:
        the content type for media element 'n'. If 'n' is out of range, null is returned.

      • getMediaUrl

        java.lang.String getMediaUrl(int n)
        A URL referencing the content of the media received in the Message. If more than one media element is indicated by NumMedia than MediaUrl{N} will be used, where N is the count of the Media
        Parameters:
        n - which media element.
        Returns:
        the url for media element 'n'. If 'n' is out of range, null is returned.

      • getSmsStatus

        java.lang.String getSmsStatus()
        Returns:
        The current status of the Sms message. Either 'sent' or 'failed'. This seems to be undocumented now.
